mods.abstract: NEGROES IN JAIL. Was committed to the jail, on the 4th day of June, two negromen, one caling himself Ned, says that he is 50 years old, 5 feet, 7 inches high, has one front tooth out, has no other marks perceivable; the other is about 5 feet, 9 inches high, says he is 31 years old. Said negroes say that they runaway from one Jules Mossy, of Bayou Teche, living between New Town and Franklin. The owner of said slaves is requested to come forward, pay charges and take said slaves away. J.H. COLE, Dep. Sheriff. Calcasieu, June the 11th, 1853.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
